name: openml-benchmark-{dataset_name}
description: Evolve classifier for OpenML dataset {dataset_name} (ID={dataset_id}) to maximize F1 score

problem.goal: Maximize F1 score on OpenML {dataset_name} classification task

evaluation.notes: Fitness is holdout F1 score, penalized if CV-holdout gap > 0.10 (overfitting)

optimization_strategies.name: hyperparameter_tuning
optimization_strategies.description: Tune model hyperparameters for this specific dataset
optimization_strategies.hint: Focus on regularization, tree depth, learning rate

optimization_strategies.name: threshold_optimization
optimization_strategies.description: Optimize classification threshold for imbalanced classes
optimization_strategies.hint: Default 0.5 is rarely optimal for imbalanced data

optimization_strategies.name: ensemble_combination
optimization_strategies.hint: Voting or stacking, use fixed weights to avoid overfitting

optimization_strategies.name: feature_preprocessing
optimization_strategies.hint: Scaling method, missing value handling, feature selection

optimization_strategies.name: class_weight_tuning
optimization_strategies.description: Adjust class weights for imbalanced datasets
optimization_strategies.hint: balanced, or custom weights based on imbalance ratio

constraints: Solution must define get_classifier() returning sklearn-compatible classifier
Classifier must implement fit(X, y) and predict(X) methods
Must not overfit: CV-holdout gap should be < 0.10
Use simpler models on small datasets (<1000 samples)
Fixed thresholds/weights generalize better than optimized

mallorn_lessons: Simpler models generalize better on small data
Use holdout to detect overfitting before accepting
